title:
A Category-Theoretic Perspective on Higher-Order Approximation Fixpoint
  Theory (Extended Version)
authors: Samuele Pollaci, Babis Kostopoulos, Marc Denecker, Bart Bogaerts
abstract:
Approximation Fixpoint Theory (AFT) is an algebraic framework designed to
study the semantics of non-monotonic logics. Despite its success, AFT is not
readily applicable to higher-order definitions. To solve such an issue, we
devise a formal mathematical framework employing concepts drawn from Category
Theory. In particular, we make use of the notion of Cartesian closed category
to inductively construct higher-order approximation spaces while preserving the
structures necessary for the correct application of AFT. We show that this
novel theoretical approach extends standard AFT to a higher-order environment,
and generalizes the AFT setting of arXiv:1804.08335 .
subjects: Computing Research Repository/Logic in Computer Science
